'''Alicia Krause''' is a [[Nephrology|nephrologist]] at [[Grey Sloan Memorial Hospital]].


Krause was treating [[Rashida Flowers]] for kidney failure. When [[Winston Ndugu]], who was placing an access port so Rashida could receive dialysis, learned she wasn't on the transplant list, he went to Krause to ask about it and was told Rashida wasn't eligible as her eGFR was too high. After placing the port, Winston went back to Krause, explaining that he'd found patients with similar numbers to Rashida who were on the list because they were white and not subjected to a multiplier applied to all Black patients due to assumptions made about Black people. Krause said she would look into it. When Rashinda's port had to be removed shortly after insertion, Winston told Krause he wouldn't reinsert it and demanded that Rashida be placed on the transplant list. He was successful and she was placed on the list.


She is a [[Board Certification|board-certified]] attending [[Nephrology|nephrologist]] at [[Grey Sloan Memorial Hospital]]. During the pandemic, many of her patients put off seeing her, so when it ended, she was very busy seeing those patients.

As evidenced by the embroidery on her lab coat, she is a Fellow of the American Society of Nephrology.

{{Intern and Resident Infobox |image = xAlmaOrtiz.png |name = Alma Ortiz |status = Alive |alias = Mama Ortiz |title = M.D. |children = [[Sara Ortiz]] |job = [[General Surgery|Surgical]] [[Resident]] |workplace = '''Current'''
[[Catherine Fox Foundation]]
'''Former'''
[[Grey Sloan Memorial Hospital]] |first appearance = [[My Happy Ending]] |last appearance = [[Sorry Doesn't Always Make It Right]] |count = |seasons = '''[[Grey's Anatomy|GA]]:''' [[Season (Grey's Anatomy)|]] |portrayed by = [[Lisa Vidal]] }} '''Alma Ortiz''' was an intern at Grey Sloan Memorial. She later transferred her residency so she could work at the [[Catherine Fox Foundation]]. Due to the growing Covid- pandemic, Alma and her fellow medical school graduates were sent to their residency programs earlier than the standard start date. They arrived on the first day and were welcomed reluctantly by [[Tom Koracick]]. When he learned there were two Drs. Ortiz, he suggested Big O and Little O as nicknames. He then left them tape and a marker to make name tags for themselves before leaving them. Alma was supposed to be in the ER, but when one intern, Jenson, quit after two hours, she ended up on discharges. She refused to discharge a patient to a nursing home that was overrun with Covid cases, saying she wanted to speak to the patient's doctor, Meredith, before doing anything further. At the end of the day, Richard Webber took Alma, along with her daughter, Sara, and [[Reza Khan]], into an OR, where he gave them a modified version of his traditional intern speech. He told them he'd make sure they learned as much as possible and promised them they'd get through it together. ''("[[My Happy Ending]]")'' When [[Marcella Diaz|Marcella]] and [[Veronica Diaz]] ended up at the hospital at the same time, Alma ended up treating Veronica. Alma comforted Veronica when she expressed regret at having passed COVID- to her mother, assuring her that her mother would never regret hugging her. Later, when both mother and daughter declined and needed ventilators, and only one was available, Alma said the protocol was to use it on the person with a better chance of survival, meaning Veronica. With that decided, they put Veronica on the ventilator. However, Maggie then had an idea to use a y-shaped tube to split the ventilator power so both of them could use a single machine. ''("[[Breathe]]")'' When the Catherine Fox Foundation sponsored a free COVID testing day at the hospital, Alma helped swab patients as they came through. She became irritated when she learned that Jackson was renting hotel rooms for patients who tested positive but had difficulty isolating from family members who weren't infected. She told him that him booking hotel rooms at full rate ousted charities who were renting them at a discounted rate to help unhoused people. He ended up having her make a list of things she would do if she had the capital, as she had the knowledge of how to help people most effectively. ''("[[Sorry Doesn't Always Make It Right]]")'' Alma later transferred her residency to Boston so she could take a job with the [[Catherine Fox Foundation]]. ''("[[Some Kind of Tomorrow]]")'' She and her daughter went through medical school at the same time and matched to Grey Sloan Memorial together. She was a [[General Surgery|surgical]] [[Internship|intern]] at [[Grey Sloan Memorial Hospital]]. When [[Jackson Avery]] took over the [[Catherine Fox Foundation]], she transferred to Boston so she could take a job with the Foundation. ''("[[Some Kind of Tomorrow]]")'' Prior to going to medical school, she was a social worker for years. xAlmaOrtiz.png|[[My Happy Ending]] xAlmaOrtiz.png|[[Breathe]] xAlmaOrtiz.png|[[Sorry Doesn't Always Make It Right]] {{Alma Ortiz Appearances}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Ortiz, Alma}} [[Category:Characters]] [[Category:GA Characters]] [[Category:GA S Characters]] [[Category:Doctors]]

'''Amethyst Vasquez''' is the daughter of [[Harmony Vasquez]].


Amethyst's mother, Harmony, had a skull-base schwannoma, so she was in the hospital to have it removed. She was concerned about her personality changing after the surgery, but Amelia reassured her. She was taken into surgery, which went well. After surgery, her family was told she was recovering in the ICU, but she'd be okay.



She was extremely worried about her mother when she had to have surgery.

'''Angela Lima''' is the mother of [[Fernanda Lima]].


Angela's daughter, Fernanda, had congenital heart disease that caused aortic stenosis. She'd had two prior open-heart surgeries and made a trip with her family from Boston to Seattle for a third. Her condition made it unsafe for her to fly on a commercial airplane, so her parents used a crowdfunding website to raise money, which they used to get an RV and drive across the country. On the way, they stopped at several tourist attractions. By the time they reached Seattle, Fernanda was starting to feel dizzy, so they rushed her directly to the PICU. She was dehydrated, so they gave her fluids and ordered more tests, which showed that her aortic stenosis had gotten worse and they were forced to covert to a Ross-Konno Procedure. It carried additional risk, but her parents agreed to it because Maggie said it was the best option. The surgery went well and her family was told she'd be okay.



She is married to [[Daniel Lima]].


She and her husband have two children: [[Rafael Lima|Rafael]] and [[Fernanda Lima|Fernanda]]. Fernanda had congenital aortic valve disease.

'''Antoinette Ndugu''' is the paternal grandmother of [[Winston Ndugu]].


Antoinette had a Zoom call with her grandson, Winston, and Winston's new girlfriend, Maggie, on her birthday. The call was going nicely until Ante's son, Clifford, joined the call. After a brief disagreement, Winston abruptly left the call, not wanting to speak to his father. This left Maggie to speak to them awkwardly. ''("[[You'll Never Walk Alone]]")''

When Maggie and Winston got engaged, Maggie called Antoinette to come to Seattle for the wedding, surprising Winston. ''("[[I'm Still Standing]]")''

On the day of Maggie and Winston's backyard wedding, Bill and Antoinette objected. They said they'd been waiting for this for their kids' entire lives and wanted them to do it right. They said they should wait and get married when things started opening up again. Maggie and Winston easily agreed and postponed the wedding. In April , a new wedding took place on the beach with a much larger guest list. ''("[[Someone Saved My Life Tonight]]")''



She is very close with both her son and grandson.


*She thinks it's sacrilegious to attend church on the computer.<ref>[[All Tomorrow's Parties]], x</ref>

'''Barbara Davis''' was in a car accident on the way from her brother-in-law's funeral.


Barbara was attending her brother-in-law, Peter's, funeral when they were in an accident. She was taken to the hospital with a cut on her forearm that needed stitches. While in the hospital, her sister, Georgia, had a heart attack and died. However, shortly afterward, Georgia sat up in her hospital bed, not dead after all. The family was shocked, but happy.



Her brother-in-law had recently died. Her sister also was pronounced dead at the hospital, but soon after, was found not to be dead.

'''Bill Pierce''' is the father of [[Maggie Pierce]].



Bill came to Seattle to comfort Maggie after her mother died. Richard sent a helicopter for him and met him on the roof. Although Bill wanted to reimburse the hospital for the expense of the helicopter ride, Richard refused to accept, stating that bringing Bill to the hospital was family business. Richard then led Bill to Diane's room, where Maggie was hugging her mother's body while Amelia and Meredith sat with her. When she saw him, Maggie got up and hugged her father. ''("[[Be Still, My Soul]]")''


Bill returned to Seattle when Maggie called him to come for her wedding. She had realized that her wedding would never be perfect because her mother wouldn't be there, so she invited her father and Winston's grandmother to come to Seattle for a small wedding. ''("[[I'm Still Standing]]")''

On the day of Maggie and Winston's backyard wedding, Bill and Antoinette objected. They said they'd been waiting for this for their kids' entire lives and wanted them to do it right. They said they should wait and get married when things started opening up again. Maggie and Winston easily agreed and postponed the wedding. In April , a new wedding took place on the beach with a much larger guest list. ''("[[Someone Saved My Life Tonight]]")''


Maggie went to visit her father when he had surgery on his hip. ''("[[Some Kind of Tomorrow]]")''



He was married to [[Diane Pierce]]. During their marriage, she had a long-term affair with the man who fixed their car. They eventually split up over it.

For their twentieth anniversary, he took dance lessons. ''("[[Harder, Better, Faster, Stronger]]")''

}}'''Braden Morris''' is a patient at [[Grey Sloan Memorial Hospital]].



Braden was diagnosed with SCID after birth. They started searching for a bone marrow donor, but ethnic donors are scarce, so they were never able to find one. However, they were able to treat his condition with enzyme injections. ''("[[You Be Illin']]")''


Braden's parents brought him into the GSM ER when he became congested. He was given antibiotics and IVIG to treat the sinusitis. However, he also had a bump on his forehead which he thought was a zit but was actually a Pott's Puffy Tumor. He was taken in to surgery to have it drained. In surgery, the doctors noted cerebral spinal fluid, meaning that the abscess had penetrated his brain, meaning they needed to call in Dr. Shepherd. ''("[[You Be Illin']]")''


After surgery, Braden was put into an isolation room because the enzyme injections had stopped working, leaving him vulnerable to infection. He woke up and was scared when he saw where he was. His parents assured him through the plastic barrier that they weren't leaving him and they love him. ''("[[You Be Illin']]")''

Two weeks post-op, Braden's infection had cleared up. However, his T-cell count was still zero, so he had to remain in isolation. He used a remote control car to break through the plastic and escape to play tag with [[Francesca McNeil|Frankie McNeil]], but he was quickly found and taken back into isolation. ''("[[I'm Winning]]")''


[[Miranda Bailey]] had the idea to use deactivated HIV to deliver the enzyme to Braden's body. His parents were initially concerned about the use of HIV, but Dr. Bailey assured them that she was not going to give Braden HIV. ''("[[Go It Alone]]")''

After receiving chemotherapy to kill off the enzyme-deficient bone marrow, Braden contracted a viral infection, concerning his parents. Worried that the treatment would make Braden even sicker, Teresa withdrew consent for the gene therapy. ''("[[Change of Heart]]")''

Unbeknownst to the Morrises, Bailey proceeded with the gene therapy as planned. It went well and Braden's T-cell count was up to . He beat the infection and was able to start eating solid food again. ''("[[We Are Never Ever Getting Back Together]]")''


After the treatment, Braden improved enough that Bailey felt comfortable discharging him. However, before she could do that, she had to inform his parents that she had gone ahead with the treatment. When she told them, they began to doubt the results. They also decided the press charges against Bailey for assault and battery. Owen and Jackson were able to assure them that the results were as she said they were, but not to drop the charges.

Stephanie Edwards lied and told them that she had forgotten to tell Bailey that they had withdrawn consent and it was entirely her fault. That still didn't convince them until they held their son and they agreed to drop the charges in exchange for Dr. Edwards being suspended for a week. ''("[[Everything I Try to Do, Nothing Seems to Turn Out Right]]")''


After being discharged, Braden had a follow-up with his pediatrician and he was very healthy. ''("[[Fear (of the Unknown)]]")''



Braden is annoyed by his parents, who are constantly worried about him because of his condition. He brushes off their attention and dislikes their nicknames for him.


[[Francesca McNeil]]
During his time in isolation, Braden befriended Frankie McNeil, who would visit his room and share gossip with him. He broke out of his isolation to play with her.


*His parents hate when he calls SCID "Bubble Boy Disease."<ref>[[You Be Illin']], x</ref>
*In the French version, his name is Brandon.

'''Brian''' came into the ER with [[Tracey Mitchell]] after she had a stroke while they were having sex.


While he was having sex with Tracey, she had a stroke. He accompanied her to the ER and wondered if anything he had done had caused the stroke. After he was told that Tracey would be okay, he asked [[Maggie Pierce|Drs. Pierce]] and [[Amelia Shepherd|Shepherd]] if he should stick around, because he liked Tracey before she had the stroke. Pierce said she\ud think it\us sweet, but Amelia said that she was the kind of girl who did what Tracey had done and advised him to leave. He then asked for her number and was told to leave.



He slept with [[Tracey Mitchell]], whom he had met at the gym. While they were having sex, she had a stroke. He was unsure if he should stick around after he heard she was going to be okay, because he liked her and wanted to ask her out on a date. After speaking with the doctors about it, he left.

'''Byron Gibbis''' is a patient who developed endocarditis due to an infection in his mouth.


Byron was taken to the hospital after being found unconscious on his front porch. He was febrile, tachycardic, and had a heart murmur. Winston ordered a cardiac CT and noted Osler's nodes on his hands. Byron woke up in the ER while they were examining him and tried to leave, saying he didn't want to get COVID and believed everyone in the hospital was sick. Maggie assured him he was safe and they'd get him whatever he needed to feel safe.

Osler's nodes indicated endocarditis, so while he had a cardiac CT, they theorized possible causes. Winston remembered him saying he hadn't left his house since lockdown started and asked Byron about his teeth. Byron said he'd used a paper clip to get a popcorn kernel out of his teeth. He had sore gums, but he refused to go to the dentist because of the pandemic. He had a dental infection which had caused the endocarditis. The CT showed an aortic valve abscess which was almost completely blocking the valves.

As they prepared Byron for his surgery, he started to freak out and left the OR. When they found him, he was huddled in a corner, nude. They managed to convince him to return to the OR and have his surgery, telling him he'd die without it. He was later said to be stable.



His best friend Rory was previously healthy, but died of COVID, increasing his anxiety.


*He was  at the time of his hospitalization.

'''CJ Madison''' is a baseball player who got a bat lodged in his chest.


CJ was playing baseball when a bat shattered and a piece of it became impaled in his chest. He was taken to the ER, where they ran a CT and then took him into surgery. The bat was easily removed, but due to the location of the injury, they knew that his dream of being called up to the majors wasn't going to be happening anytime soon.


He plays on a minor league baseball team. He was looking forward to being called up to the majors before he was injured.

'''Casey''' was a firefighter who was injured in the Mt. Baker fire and later died from his injuries.


While fighting a wildfire on Mt. Baker, Casey was severely burned. He was taken to the ER, where he insisted that the doctors treat the other firefighters first. He'd been burned several times in previous fires, to the point where his wife said he smells like bacon. When [[Miranda Bailey]] examined him, she was able to see his lung from the outside. There wasn't an available OR, so they moved him to a burn unit bed. Due to a partially-collapsed lung and severe smoke inhalation, Casey struggled to breathe. The injuries were also putting strain on his body, causing heart failure. However, he refused to be intubated as his wife was on her way and he wanted to talk to her. He and the doctors both knew he was going to die, so they kept him comfortable as they waited for his wife to arrive. When [[Ruth]] got to the hospital, they spoke for a few minutes, both acknowledging that he was dying and they knew that was coming someday. She sat with him and they talked until he died a few moments later.



He is married to [[Ruth]]. He once burned himself on the oven making a birthday cake for his wife's th birthday. Because of his work as a firefighter, they both had accepted the reality that he could die in the performance of his duties. When the time came, she sat with him while he died.


He and his wife have two children, Doug and Susan. When Ruth got the call about Casey, she called the kids and said that their father loves them and they told her they love him, too.


He was a firefighter with the [[Seattle Fire Department]]. He had a burn scar on his thigh from a previous wildfire and one on his shoulder. While fighting a fire on Mt. Baker, he was seriously burned and later died of his injuries.


*He was the only person to die in the Mt. Baker fire.

'''Clervie Martin''' is a girl who had surgery on her skull to re-shape it.


Clervie was born with craniosynostosis, which caused her skull to fuse prematurely. Her pediatrician told her parents it was a mild case and would resolve on its own, but by the time she was three, it hadn't and she had an abnormally-shaped skull. Tom found her case and offered the parents a pro bono surgery in exchange for being allowed to film the surgery and their family before and after. Having no other way to afford the surgery, they agreed, though it made them visibly uncomfortable.

Noticing their discomfort and wanting to ease it, Jackson went to the parents and gave them the option to decline the cameras access, promising that they wouldn't have to pay for Clervie's surgery either way. They chose to proceed without the cameras. Clervie's surgery went well and her parents sat by her bed in the PICU afterward.


*She was three years old at the time of her surgery.

{{DEFAULTSORT:Martin, Clervie}}

'''Clifford Ndugu''' is the father of [[Winston Ndugu]].



When his wife was diagnosed with cancer, he started drinking more and ended up in jail multiple times. His wife then used the money that was meant to be for her treatment to bail him out on more than one occasion, which created a rift between him and his son, Winston. ''("[[Road Trippin']]")''


Years later, Clifford and Winston were still estranged. Clifford doesn't think well of Winston, reminding his mother and Maggie that he almost failed sixth grade. Winston defended that he did that because he was busy helping his mother while Clifford gambled away all their money. When he joined the Zoom call on his mother's birthday, he told Winston they should try to keep the peace. Winston said he was right and then quickly left the call. ''("[[You'll Never Walk Alone]]")''



He is estranged from his son, Winston, but is close with his mother and his other son, Wendell.


*He has a problem with gambling.
*He also has a drinking problem, which led to him being jailed more than once.<ref>[[Road Trippin']], x</ref>

'''Clive Johnson''' is a man [[Maggie Pierce|Maggie]] met on Tinder.



Clive and Maggie matched on Tinder and set a date. However, after a long day at work, Maggie forgot about the date and was surprised when Clive arrived to pick her up. Despite this, she declined a rain check and they went out on the date as scheduled. ''("[[---]]")''


Maggie continued to see Clive. During a subsequent date, she received a text message, reminding her that she was missing dance class with Richard. She apologized to Clive, saying that it wasn't that she didn't want to see him, but she did have to leave. ''("[[Harder, Better, Faster, Stronger]]")''


Maggie decided to host a game night when Meredith and Amelia asked to meet Clive. They played some games and had fun, but the night was ended when Clive's wife showed up. Jackson said they needed to work it out somewhere else and showed them both out the door, telling Clive to forget Maggie's address\uaand to never call her again. ''("[[Games People Play]]")''



[[Maggie Pierce]]
He went on a date with [[Maggie Pierce]]. ''("[[---]]")''

After the first date, they continued to see each other. ''("[[Harder, Better, Faster, Stronger]]")''

They continued to date until his wife showed up at game night, after which Jackson told him to leave and to not call Maggie again, effectively ending the relationship. ''("[[Games People Play]]")''

[[Daphne Johnson]]
He's married to Daphne, but cheated on her with Maggie, which she implied wasn't the first time. She tracked his phone and confronted him at Maggie's game night. ''("[[Games People Play]]")''


He is a stock broker. Because of this, he doesn't understand when Maggie talks about medicine. ''("[[Harder, Better, Faster, Stronger]]")''

'''Dana Hamilton''' is [[Tom Koracick|Tom]]'s ex-wife.



Dana's first son, David, died at the age of ten when he was hit in the head with a baseball bat. This loss broke up her marriage and she and Tom divorced.


Later, Dana remarried and had another son, whom she named Guthrie. Guthrie bore a strong resemblance to David. When he was ten, he collapsed during a pastry class and was diagnosed with a brain tumor which had spread to his spine. Desperate her to help her son, she took him to Grey Sloan Memorial to see her ex-husband, Tom, in the hopes he could save Guthrie. Tom initially said he couldn't do the surgery because she was basically family and hospital policy prohibited it, but after Amelia was forced to step away mid-surgery due to having contractions, Tom stepped in and finished. Despite a brief hiccup, he was able to resect the tumor and the met in one surgery and told Dana and her new husband that Guthrie would be okay with some radiation.



She is married to [[Ed Hamilton]]. Before Ed, she was married to [[Tom Koracick]], but their marriage fell apart after the death of their son.


Her first son, David, died when he was ten after being hit in the head with a baseball bat.

Her second son, Guthrie, bore a strong resemblance to David. When he was ten, they learned he had a brain tumor that had spread to his spine and Dana worried she'd lose another son.

'''Daniel Lima''' is the father of [[Fernanda Lima]].


Daniel's daughter, Fernanda, had congenital heart disease that caused aortic stenosis. She'd had two prior open-heart surgeries and made a trip with her family from Boston to Seattle for a third. Her condition made it unsafe for her to fly on a commercial airplane, so her parents used a crowdfunding website to raise money, which they used to get an RV and drive across the country. On the way, they stopped at several tourist attractions. By the time they reached Seattle, Fernanda was starting to feel dizzy, so they rushed her directly to the PICU. Daniel also had some back pain, which he attributed to spending so much time driving. Fernanda was dehydrated, so they gave her fluids and ordered more tests, which showed that her aortic stenosis had gotten worse and they were forced to covert to a Ross-Konno Procedure. It carried additional risk, but her parents agreed to it because Maggie said it was the best option. The surgery went well and her family was told she'd be okay.



He is married to [[Angela Lima]].


He and his wife have two children: [[Rafael Lima|Rafael]] and [[Fernanda Lima|Fernanda]]. Fernanda had congenital aortic valve disease.


*He and his family are Brazilian.
*He speaks English and Portuguese.

'''David Morris''' is the father of [[Braden Morris]], a patient at [[Grey Sloan Memorial Hospital]].



Braden was diagnosed with SCID after birth. They started searching for a bone marrow donor, but ethnic donors are scarce, so they were never able to find one. However, they were able to treat his condition with enzyme injections. ''("[[You Be Illin']]")''


Braden's parents brought him into the GSM ER when he became congested. He was given antibiotics and IVIG to treat the sinusitis. However, he also had a bump on his forehead which he thought was a zit but was actually a Pott\us Puffy Tumor. He was taken in to surgery to have it drained. In surgery, the doctors noted cerebral spinal fluid, meaning that the abscess had penetrated his brain, meaning they needed to call in Dr. Shepherd. ''("[[You Be Illin']]")''


After surgery, Braden was put into an isolation room because the enzyme injections had stopped working, leaving him vulnerable to infection. He woke up and was scared when he saw where he was. His parents assured him through the plastic barrier that they weren\ut leaving him and they love him. ''("[[You Be Illin']]")''

Two weeks post-up, Braden's infection had cleared up. However, his T-cell count was still zero, so he had to remain in isolation. He used a remote control car to break through the plastic and escape to play tag, but he was quickly found and taken back into isolation. ''("[[I'm Winning]]")''


[[Miranda Bailey]] had the idea to use deactivated HIV to deliver the enzyme to Braden's body. His parents were initially concerned about the use of HIV, but Dr. Bailey assured them that she was not going to give Braden HIV. ''("[[Go It Alone]]")''

After receiving chemotherapy to kill off the enzyme-deficient bone marrow, Braden contracted a viral infection, concerning his parents. Worried that the treatment would make Braden even sicker, Teresa withdrew consent for the gene therapy. ''("[[Change of Heart]]")''

Unbeknownst to the Morrises, Bailey proceeded with the gene therapy as planned. It went well and Braden's T-cell count was up to . He beat the infection and was able to start eating solid food again. ''("[[We Are Never Ever Getting Back Together]]")''


After the treatment, Braden improved enough that Bailey felt comfortable discharging him. However, before she could do that, she had to inform his parents that she had gone ahead with the treatment. When she told them, they began to doubt the results. They also decided the press charges against Bailey for assault and battery. Owen and Jackson were able to assure them that the results were as she said they were, but not to drop the charges.

Stephanie Edwards lied and told them that she had forgotten to tell Bailey that they had withdrawn consent and it was entirely her fault. That still didn't convince them until they held their son and they agreed to drop the charges in exchange for Dr. Edwards being suspended for a week. ''("[[Everything I Try to Do, Nothing Seems to Turn Out Right]]")''


After being discharged, Braden had a follow-up with his pediatrician and it was reported that he was very healthy. ''("[[Fear (of the Unknown)]]")''



[[Teresa Morris]]
David is married to Teresa Morris, with whom he has one son, [[Braden Morris]].


[[Braden Morris]]
David has a son, Braden, who has SCID. Because of Braden\us condition, David is constantly concerned about his health, much to his annoyance.


*He hates when Braden refers to SCID as "Bubble Boy Disease".<ref>[[You Be Illin']], x</ref>

}}

'''Diane Pierce'''\uawas the mother of [[Maggie Pierce]]. She ultimately died of inflammatory breast cancer.



She was born in a two-room shack with an outhouse. ''("[[Be Still, My Soul]]")''

She and her husband adopted Maggie and raised her. The marriage fell apart while they pretended everything was fine to protect Maggie. Diane started an affair of  years with the man who serviced their car.

Diane was very pleased with how easy Maggie was. She never talked back, she had good grades, and her room was always clean. She was concerned when Maggie left Boston for Seattle and called her a lot, but she was happy Maggie did so after learning about the people she met. About a year after Maggie had left the city, Diane and Bill got a divorce, after which Diane moved to Hawaii to make soaps.


When Diane noticed a rash, she went to a local doctor and started treatment, but it didn't look good. As she had always taught her daughter to find the smartest person in the room or otherwise another room, she found [[Jackson Avery]] was the best and also a friend of Maggie's. She scheduled an appointment with him. However, realizing that there was a real chance of her dying soon, she started skydiving and traveling the world. ''("[[What's Inside]]")''


When the time for the appointment came, Diane went to Seattle, a surprise to her daughter. She quickly bonded with all Maggie's colleagues, who all liked her. Jackson examined her rash and took a biopsy, which showed inflammatory breast cancer. She asked him to help her tell Maggie and he said he would and also offered to refer her to local specialists and fly to Hawaii to operate on her.

Diane then went to Meredith's house where she folded laundry, made lasagna, and put the kids to bed. When Maggie came home and confronted her mom about her behavior, Diane decided not to tell her and instead just said she'd leave and when Maggie was ready to have her in her life, she could let Diane know. ''("[[None of Your Business]]")''


Diane came back to Seattle to have her mastectomy. She'd been going to chemotherapy and was getting a good response, but shocked Jackson by telling him she still hadn't told Maggie about the cancer. She wanted to have the surgery and then tell Maggie, but Jackson said he wouldn't go forward with the surgery until she'd told Maggie. After Maggie came in and tried to be supportive, Diane told Maggie about the breast cancer. The next day, she went in for her surgery, but during surgery, the doctors found something unexpected. ''("[[Till I Hear It From You]]")''


After her mastectomy, Diane got the news that her cancer had spread. She had surgery to remove more cancer from her body and continued to have radiation and chemotherapy. When she complained of stomach pain, Meredith ordered a new CT, which showed a met near her liver, which was causing the pain. When Meredith advised against removing it, Maggie pressured Diane to fire her. Maggie then found a clinical trial with promising early results that she could get into if they could lower her LFTs. Bailey figured out a way to place a stent to lower Diane's LFTs and get her into the trial. The procedure worked, but Bailey, Richard, and Jackson didn't think the trial was a good idea. Despite this and Richard advising Diane that it wasn't a good idea, Maggie pushed forward and Diane supported her, believing Maggie wouldn't do anything to hurt her.

Once on the treatment, Diane had multiple side effects. She got an infection in her arm and blood built up. She had to have fluid aspirated from her back, but she eventually started to feel a little better. She taught Maggie to make her lasagna and told Maggie to invite all her friends over to have dinner together. At the dinner, Diane started coughing heavily. She soon coughed up some blood and they rushed her to the hospital. She had a tear in her esophagus, which Richard repaired with difficulty. Maggie wanted to get her up and moving again after the surgery as soon as possible, because she'd lose her spot in the trial if she missed a treatment. Richard went and talked to Diane privately, to tell her she didn't have to keep going with the treatment if she didn't want to. She told him Maggie was a gift to her and if she died, it would give Maggie darkness not to know she did everything she could and she didn't want to do that. Richard told her Maggie was strong and she could handle it. Maggie tried to call around to find newer treatment possibilities for her mother, but Diane told her it was time to stop fighting.

Later, while Diane tried to give Maggie life advice, Maggie painted her nails. When the smell overwhelmed her, Maggie went to open a window and saw that it had stopped raining. When she went back to the bed, her mother was dead. She continued to paint her mom's nails as she cried. ''("[[Be Still, My Soul]]")''

After her death, Jackson saw her loaded file that showed her medical history before she came to see him. He discovered she had already found out she was sick before she came to see him, and he guessed that she came to Seattle because he would do everything possible to cure her because of how close he was to Maggie, as well as take care of Maggie if she really were to die. ''("[[What's Inside]]")''


Diane appeared in Maggie's fever dream as a beacon of warmth and comfort after Maggie had read Ellis's letter. ''("[[The Makings of You]]")''



She was married to Maggie's father. However, she had a long-term affair with the man who fixed their car. They ultimately split up over it. She said leaving Maggie's father was the moment she finally felt like she could breathe again. ''("[[None of Your Business]]")''


When she surprised Maggie with a visit, Maggie was upset that she didn't give her advance warning that she was coming. Maggie also disliked how she quickly bonded with the other doctors at the hospital. ''("[[None of Your Business]]")'' She told Meredith she always wanted to have more kids, so Maggie could have a brother or sister. She was glad when Maggie found Meredith. ''("[[Be Still, My Soul]]")''


Diane quickly bonded with all Maggie's colleagues. She made plans to have dinner with Richard, but cancelled those plans when she was diagnosed with breast cancer. ''("[[None of Your Business]]")''

While she was in chemo, she also formed a relationship with her nurse, Aurora, to the point where she knew Aurora's son, Lee, was re-taking his driver's test, which he'd failed twice before. ''("[[Be Still, My Soul]]")''


She made soap in Hawaii.


*She brought her engagement ring to Seattle with her to give to Maggie.<ref>[[Be Still, My Soul]], x</ref>
*She was afraid of heights.<ref>[[What's Inside]], x</ref>

'''Ed Hamilton''' is the husband of [[Dana Hamilton]] and father of [[Guthrie Hamilton]].


Ed's son, Guthrie, was making croissants in a pastry class when he collapsed. He was diagnosed with a brain tumor which had spread to his spine, causing motor weakness in his limbs and sensory deficits. His mom, desperate to save him, took him to Grey Sloan Memorial to see her ex-husband, Tom, a neurosurgeon. Before they met, she warned Guthrie that since he looked like his deceased brother, it might freak Tom out to meet him. Due to the resemblance and the relationship to Guthrie's mother, Tom said he couldn't do the surgery. However, when Amelia started having contractions during the surgery and believed she was in labor, Tom was forced to step in and take over. Despite a hiccup, he was able to finish the surgery and Dana and Ed were told he'd be okay with some radiation.



He is married to [[Dana Hamilton]].


His son, Guthrie, had a brain tumor that spread to his spine when he was ten years old.

'''Ellen Weaver''' is the wife of [[Jeremy Weaver]].


Ellen's husband, Jeremy, came into the ER with what he believed to be heartburn. Dr. Pierce examined him and ruled out a heart attack and aortic dissection, so she handed his case off to Dr. Bailey, who began to run tests to find out the cause. Jeremy was in a rush to get out of the hospital as quickly as possible so he could get back to work, so he agreed to skip a less invasive test and go straight to esophagogastroduodenoscopy. However, the EGD revealed a large tumor, which the doctors determined to be adenocarcinoma. His diet caused severe acid reflux, which made his esophagus the perfect breeding ground for cancer. They planned an esophagectomy, which involved removing part of his esophagus along with the tumor and replacing it with part of his colon. However, shortly after they started his surgery, he coded and was unable to be resuscitated.



She was married to [[Jeremy Weaver]] until his death.


She and her husband have one daughter, [[Erin Weaver]]. When they were informed that Jeremy died, they clung to each other and cried.

'''Elliott Calhoun''' is a patient who came in for his fourth aortic valve replacement.


Elliott was in the hospital for his fourth aortic valve replacement due to congenital aortic stenosis. While he was fasting in preparation for his surgery, his wife, Finley's, water broke, a month before her due date. Their son, Jasper, was born that day, one month early. He was taken to the NICU, where he was said to be doing well. Elliott was taken into surgery. His valve replacement went well, but his heart didn't restart when they were finished like it should have. Teddy believed it was due to hibernating myocardium and said they just needed to give Elliott more time. They told Finley about this and she was upset that they couldn't tell her definitively that it would work. ''("[[Let's All Go to the Bar]]")''

Not long afterward, Elliott's heart had healed enough that it started beating again. Andrew slowly weaned him off the pacing wires and ECMO and Elliott's condition stabilized. ''("[[Help Me Through the Night]]")''



He is married to [[Finley Calhoun]].


He and his wife have one son, [[Jasper Calhoun]].


*He was  at the time of his fourth valve replacement.

'''Ethan Boyd''' is an [[Attending|attending]] [[Radiology|radiologist]] at [[Grey Sloan Memorial Hospital]].



When an earthquake hit Seattle, Ethan was in an elevator with [[Maggie Pierce]]. When the elevator stopped moving as a safety precaution, Ethan mentioned that it had happened the last time he was in an elevator during an earthquake. She was shocked as she didn't know earthquakes were a potential danger of living in Seattle. When she said she'd have to avoid being in elevators with her, he said he would just start taking the stairs. ''("[[I Feel the Earth Move]]")''


Maggie and Ethan met again when Ethan did the films for [[Jean Dominy]], who had a hip injury shortly after having heart surgery. After they reviewed the scans, Ethan flirted with Maggie and asked her out on a date. She declined and they had an awkward moment before he pointed out that she was in what is basically his office, so she should be the one leaving.

After the Jean Dominy case was completed, Maggie found Ethan, again in an elevator, and accepted his date. After a few minutes of awkward conversation, they agreed to have their date at the end of the week. ''("[[I Feel the Earth Move]]")''


He and Maggie went on a date, but according to him, she talked the whole time and then paid. Maggie explained to him that she brought the thunder, which works at work, but isn't great for dates. After she explained what happened, he agreed to give it another chance and said next time, he'd bring the thunder. ''("[[Crazy Love]]")''


Within six months of breaking up with Maggie, Ethan was engaged and invited Maggie to his wedding. ''("[[I Choose You]]")''



[[Maggie Pierce]]
He had a crush on [[Maggie Pierce]]. He asked her on a date while they worked on a case together. She initially declined, but after getting a push from a patient, she accepted his offer and they agreed to go on a date later that week. ''("[[I Feel the Earth Move]]")''

They went on the date, but Ethan didn't think it went well, saying that Maggie talked the whole time, ordered for him, and then paid and left. After explaining to him what had happened, Ethan agreed to go on another date with her. ''("[[Crazy Love]]")''

He and Maggie dated for about six months before she got bored and let it fizzle out. ''("[[I Choose You]]")''

Fianc\uee
Within six months of breaking up with Maggie, he got engaged to someone else. ''("[[I Choose You]]")''


[[Callie Torres]]
He appears to have a good professional relationship with Callie Torres. They are on a first-name basis.


Ethan is an [[Attending|attending]] [[Radiology|radiologist]] at [[Grey Sloan Memorial Hospital]].


*At his character's introduction, Ethan was wearing a waist-length lab coat normally seen on [[Medical School|medical students]]. His second appearance, Ethan was wearing a full-length lab coat.
*He spit a little when he talked.<ref>[[I Choose You]], x</ref>
*He said All-Timers instead of Alzheimer's.<ref>[[I Choose You]], x</ref>

'''Felix Pelgado''' is a patient who was diagnosed with a brain tumor after having shoulder surgery.


Felix had surgery to repair a tear in his shoulder. Four months later, during a follow-up visit with his surgeon, Link, he complained that he still wasn't able to pitch at the same level as before his injury. While he was talking to Link, Amelia walked in and saw him struggle to open a water bottle with his right hand before switching to his left, making her think he had a neurological problem causing one-sided weakness. She asked him to come to the hospital for an MRI, which showed a meningioma at C-C. She took him into surgery, where she removed the whole tumor. After surgery, he was stable and awake and had improved strength in his arms.


*He plays baseball at a junior college and hopes to be recruited to a Division  school.

'''Fernanda Lima''' is a child who came to the hospital to have heart surgery.


Fernanda had congenital heart disease that caused aortic stenosis. She'd had two prior open-heart surgeries and made a trip with her family from Boston to Seattle for a third. Her condition made it unsafe for her to fly on a commercial airplane, so her parents used a crowdfunding website to raise money, which they used to get an RV and drive across the country. On the way, they stopped at several tourist attractions. By the time they reached Seattle, Fernanda was starting to feel dizzy, so they rushed her directly to the PICU. She was dehydrated, so they gave her fluids and ordered more tests, which showed that her aortic stenosis had gotten worse and they were forced to covert to a Ross-Konno Procedure. It carried additional risk, but her parents agreed to it because Maggie said it was the best option. The surgery went well and her family was told she'd be okay.



When she and her family had to travel from Boston to Seattle for her to have heart surgery, they took the time to spend together as a family, stopping at tourist sites along the way.


*She was thirteen at the time of her surgery.
*She loves salted caramel ice cream and action movies.
*She and her family are Brazilian.

'''Francesca McNeil''' was a patient at [[Grey Sloan Memorial Hospital]] who developed cardiomyopathy along with her two siblings.



Ivy, , was diagnosed with dilated cardiomyopathy. She spent four months waiting for a heart transplant before one came through. The transplant was successful and Ivy began to recover. ''("[[You Be Illin']]")''

Two weeks post-op, Ivy's indices were good and she was recovering well. ''("[[I'm Winning]]")''

Later, Ivy spiked a fever. Cristina took her to the OR for a biopsy, which revealed that she was rejecting her donor heart. They treated it with anti-rejection medication and put Ivy back on the transplant list. ''("[[Go It Alone]]")''

Still in full rejection, Ivy was kept in isolation. While Frankie was in surgery to receive a heart transplant, Ivy declined, bumping up her status to A. When a second heart was found to replace the one that failed for Frankie, it was instead redirected to Ivy. The transplant was successful and she was recovering well. ''("[[Change of Heart]]")''

Ivy was later discharged to recover at home. ''("[[We Are Never Ever Getting Back Together]]")''


While Ivy was in surgery getting her new heart, [[Jon McNeil]] brought their second child, Frankie, into the ER because she was coughing up pink fluid. She, too, was diagnosed with cardiomyopathy. The doctors inserted a pacemaker. ''("[[You Be Illin']]")''

Two weeks after her pacemaker was inserted, Frankie was doing well, even walking around the hospital. ''("[[I'm Winning]]")''

While playing Hide and Seek with [[Braden Morris]], Frankie collapsed in a hallway. When she was found, her pulse was weak and she wasn't breathing well. She was taken into surgery to insert an LVAD and then she was put on the transplant list. ''("[[Go It Alone]]")''

Frankie's LVAD failed to reverse the heart damage, which left her in desperate need of a heart. One became available, but when they transplanted it, they discovered that it had been damaged during retrieval and couldn't keep her alive. When a second heart became available, Arizona and Alex went to retrieve it personally while Frankie was kept on bypass in the hospital. While they were gone, Ivy declined rapidly, bumping up her status. Cristina made the decision to redirect the second heart to Ivy, who was more stable and had a better chance of survival, while she attempted a total artificial heart on Frankie. That procedure was unsuccessful and Frankie was pronounced dead in the OR. ''("[[Change of Heart]]")''

After Frankie's funeral, Sabine snapped at an orderly who tried to take Frankie's pillow. ''("[[We Are Never Ever Getting Back Together]]")''


While waiting in Frankie\us room while the doctors talked to his parents, Link started to cough up pink fluid just as Frankie had. ''("[[You Be Illin']]")''

Link was diagnosed with cardiomyopathy and declined quickly. They attempted to put him on a Berlin Heart, but he was clotting too much. They put him on ECMO and he stabilized. However, after  days on ECMO, he began clotting even with heparin. Owen was able to convince the FDA to give compassionate release to use a drug-eluting heart pump to buy Link more time to wait for a heart transplant. The device was implanted successfully and they said they'd wait  hours and start to wake him up. ''("[[I'm Winning]]")''

Link's heart pump worked well, keeping him stable as he waited for a heart transplant. ''("[[Change of Heart]]")''

Link was later discharged and allowed to wait for a heart transplant at home. ''("[[We Are Never Ever Getting Back Together]]")''

A heart became available for Link during the aftermath of the explosion at the Mall of the Woods. Despite this, they had Link come in to [[Grey Sloan Memorial Hospital]] for his transplant. The transplant was successful. ''("[[Fear (of the Unknown)]]")''


A few weeks after Link's heart transplant, [[Maggie Pierce]], who was looking into genetic causes of cardiomyopathy for another patient, discovered what had caused the McNeil kids' cardiomyopathy. A mutation called RAF  had been discovered to cause cardiomyopathy only a week before and all three McNeil children had that mutation. Sabine was relieved that it wasn't something in their house or something she had done. ''("[[Puzzle With a Piece Missing]]")''



Frankie has two siblings, both of whom, like herself, have been diagnosed with cardiomyopathy.


[[Braden Morris]]
While her siblings were hospitalized, she formed a friendship with Braden Morris, who was in an isolation room on the same floor. Frankie would hide and he would find her with a remote controlled car with a camera on top.


*An orderly at the hospital came to her funeral.

'''Frankie''' came into the ER after the roof of the restaurant where he works collapsed.


Frankie was working at Grandinetti's, washing dishes, when the roof collapsed. His arm was traumatically amputated and he lay in dirty dishwater for a while before someone found him and he was taken to the ER. They took him into surgery and the arm was able to be salvaged, but because of the time he'd spent in the water, his wound was contaminated, so they couldn't reattach the arm. They were going to make it an amputation, but [[Lexie Grey]] suggested that they temporarily attach the arm to another area in order to save his arm. She was told he'd have some loss of function, but they agreed to try.

Frankie freaked out when he woke up and saw his arm attached to his leg, but Lexie convinced him that it was a good thing and there was a lawyer who believed he could make a lot of money because they'd left him lying in dirty dishwater after the roof collapse. She also said that the doctors wanted to talk to him because what happened to him was rare.


He's a dishwasher at Grandinetti's. He says he likes it because he doesn't much like talking to people and they mostly leave him alone back there.

'''Georgia Fisher''' was in a car accident on the way from her husband's funeral.


Georgia's husband, Peter, had died. The whole family attended his funeral. As they were leaving, a car hit one of the limos, which caused a chain reaction, which resulted in the hearse being hit, knocking open the casket and causing Peter's body to go flying. Those injured, including Georgia's sister, Barbara, and her two children, Morgan and Julian, were taken to the hospital. Peter's body was also taken there.

At the hospital, Georgia learned that most of her family was doing well. She was also told that her estranged daughter, Kara, was at the hospital. She'd caused the accident when she arrived late to the funeral. After learning that, she sat with her husband's body for a while, holding his hand and telling him about Kara coming.

When she was told it was time for her husband's body to be retrieved by the funeral home, she didn't respond. Then she clenched her chest. She was having a heart attack. They took her into a trauma room and attempted resuscitation for over  minutes before finally pronouncing her dead.

Morgan and Julian were upset to learn that their mother had died and blamed Kara. Julian even went to Kara's bedside to proclaim that she'd killed their mother. In their grief, the family decided to hold a makeshift funeral, paying their respects to Georgia. While Morgan was in the room with her mother, she suddenly called out that her mother had squeezed her hand. The doctors were doubtful, saying it was only a residual reflex, but then Georgia suddenly sat up in the bed.

The doctors did some tests to check Georgia's neuro function and check her heart, but she was proclaimed healthy, despite being "dead" for over an hour.



She was married for over forty years to her husband, Peter. She said when she imagined it, she always thought they'd die together, holding hands.


She and Peter have three children: Julian, Morgan, and Kara. Kara was estranged from their family, but rejoined their lives after Peter's death.

'''Gerlie Bernardo''' is a patient who spent over eight months in the hospital due to COVID-.


Gerlie, was in the hospital with COVID, which she believed she'd gotten at the assisted living facility where she worked from a man named Earl. Bailey examined her and ordered high-flow oxygen, chest films, steroids, and Remdesivir. She spent two weeks on a ventilator.

A month later, in September, Gerlie was discharged from the hospital to go home and finish recovering. She was warned not to try returning to work too soon. However, as she went to leave the hospital, she collapsed and had to be taken back inside. In October, Gerlie was still fighting her post-COVID complications in the hospital. She'd had a VATS procedure and had a pneumothorax and multifocal pneumonia. Meredith did a bronchoscope on her.

On December , she had to be put on ECMO. In January , Meredith asked to put her on the transplant list for lungs, a request Bailey denied due to her risk of sudden death. Meredith put pressure on Bailey and she ultimately agreed to the transplant. In April , they found a donor and Gerlie received her lung transplant, which was successful. Gerlie woke up after her surgery surprised to see Meredith sitting by her bedside. Meredith promised Gerlie that she wasn't going anywhere.



She has a good relationship with her patient, Earl. When she was hospitalized, she was eager to get back to him.


She is a nurse at Lakeforest Assisted Living. At her job, she'd been caring for a man named Earl for seven years.


She was  at the time of her initial admission to the hospital.

'''Griffin Ford''' is a billionaire who came to the hospital to search for a reason for him making an error.


Griffin made a mistake while working on a rocket which led to it exploding over a gas station, causing several injuries, including the evisceration of [[Rigo Vasquez]]. ''("[[Satellite of Love]]")''

As bad press brewed and there was talk of criminal charges against him, Griffin went to Grey Sloan Memorial saying he believed there was a medical reason why he made that mistake and caused the rocket explosion. Tom got Meredith to run some tests, but when her other patient got a CT, she called in Jackson to take over. Jackson completed his tests and said there was nothing wrong with him and it seemed like he was just looking for an explanation where there wasn't one. Griffin then went to Tom and said he couldn't do all the good work he was working on if he were put in jail. He pressured Tom to lie and say something was wrong with him. After some thinking, Tom came back to him and said he had an aneurysm which could have affected his judgment and might require surgery. Tom said when they'd know whether or not he'd need surgery would depend on how large the check was. ''("[[Life on Mars?]]")''



He was married, but said he was a bad husband.


He owns a large tech company.


*He sucks at golf.
*He has a dog named Emmie.
*He has a vitamin D deficiency.

'''Guthrie Hamilton''' is the son of [[Dana Hamilton]].


Guthrie was making croissants in a pastry class when he collapsed. He was diagnosed with a brain tumor which had spread to his spine, causing motor weakness in his limbs and sensory deficits. His mom, desperate to save him, took him to Grey Sloan Memorial to see her ex-husband, Tom, a neurosurgeon. Before they met, she warned Guthrie that since he looked like his deceased brother, it might freak Tom out to meet him. Due to the resemblance and the relationship to Guthrie's mother, Tom said he couldn't do the surgery. However, when Amelia started having contractions during the surgery and believed she was in labor, Tom was forced to step in and take over. Despite a hiccup, he was able to finish the surgery and Dana and Ed were told he'd be okay with some radiation.



His half-brother, David, died before he was born. He bears a striking resemblance to David.


*He was ten years old at the time of his surgery.
*He asks everyone what single food they'd bring to a deserted island.

'''Gwendolyn Yates''' is a patient who was in the hospital awaiting a heart transplant.


Gwendolyn had a history of cardiac amyloidosis for which she had been taking medication for years. She came to the hospital with worsening shortness of breath and edema. Maggie told her her protein deposits had caused congestive heart failure. She was also developing clots, requiring an IVC filter. She was told she'd have to remain in the ICU until a heart transplant came through. Gwen had no family after her husband had died the prior October. She had adopted a dog named Jupiter, but Jupiter got out of the house during a storm and her condition left her so exhausted she couldn't look for him.

A few weeks later, Gwen had her heart transplant. Once her new heart was in, the edema resolved and her condition improved, but she told the doctors she had woken up with a headache that was worsening, so they paged neuro. A week of exams and scans were all normal, though her headaches persisted. Gwen later admitted to faking the headaches because she didn't want to go home. Gwen was ultimately discharged. As she left the hospital, Richard surprised her with her dog. He'd used the interns to call shelters and locate him. Gwen happily took Jupiter and went home.



Her husband had died less than a year prior to her hospitalization.


*She was  at the time of her heart transplant.

'''Hazel Talbert''' is the wife of [[Margot Talbert]].


Hazel's wife, Margot, came into the ER with throbbing abdominal pain that radiated to her back. She told the doctors it had started that morning. They examined her and find that her abdomen was pulsating, so they ordered a CT, which showed an abdominal aortic aneurysm. While she was in the CT, they asked if she could call anyone for her and she said no. She admitted that she'd been having the pain for a few months and said Hazel would be angry to know she hadn't gotten it looked out because she told Hazel she had. As they prepared for her surgery, Winston informed her they were obligated to notify next of kin and would be calling her wife. Margot was upset by that and Maggie told her that wasn't necessarily true. Winston asked her what would happen if she died. Margot then coded, because her aneurysm had ruptured. They rushed to start her surgery and were able to repair the damage. After her surgery, Hazel came to see her and thanked the doctors for saving her life.



She is married to [[Margot Talbert]].

'''Herschel Kitano''' is the husband of [[Vera Kitano]].


Herschel was reaching for a large book in his and his wife's home office when he dropped it, hitting his wife's foot. She went to the ER, where they got an x-ray which showed fractures in two of her metatarsals. She had surgery to repair the fractures, but when she woke up afterward, she believed everyone else was singing when they weren't and believed she was talking when she was actually singing all her words. They got a neuro consult and she had an MRI, which showed no signs of a stroke or bleed. They decided to keep her overnight to monitor her and see if it was a side-effect of the anesthesia. Later that day, she developed a tension pneumothorax. They were able to relieve the pressure and she stabilized, but Herschel realized he just wanted her to be safe and sung to her that he loved her.



He is married to [[Vera Kitano]].


He is a professor at the University of Washington, like his wife.


*He once had a car in which the seat belt alert was broken and beeped all the time.

'''Ivy McNeil''' is a patient at [[Grey Sloan Memorial Hospital]] who suffered from cardiomyopathy, along with her two siblings.



Ivy, , was diagnosed with dilated cardiomyopathy. She spent four months waiting for a heart transplant before one came through. The transplant was successful and Ivy began to recover. ''("[[You Be Illin']]")''

Two weeks post-op, Ivy's indices were good and she was recovering well. ''("[[I'm Winning]]")''

Later, Ivy spiked a fever. Cristina took her to the OR for a biopsy, which revealed that she was rejecting her donor heart. They treated it with anti-rejection medication and put Ivy back on the transplant list. ''("[[Go It Alone]]")''

Still in full rejection, Ivy was kept in isolation. While Frankie was in surgery to receive a heart transplant, Ivy declined, bumping up her status to A. When a second heart was found to replace the one that failed for Frankie, it was instead redirected to Ivy. The transplant was successful and she was recovering well. ''("[[Change of Heart]]")''

Ivy was later discharged to recover at home. ''("[[We Are Never Ever Getting Back Together]]")''


While Ivy was in surgery getting her new heart, [[Jon McNeil]] brought their second child, Frankie, into the ER because she was coughing up pink fluid. She, too, was diagnosed with cardiomyopathy. The doctors inserted a pacemaker. ''("[[You Be Illin']]")''

Two weeks after her pacemaker was inserted, Frankie was doing well, even walking around the hospital. ''("[[I'm Winning]]")''

While playing Hide and Seek with [[Braden Morris]], Frankie collapsed in a hallway. When she was found, her pulse was weak and she wasn't breathing well. She was taken into surgery to insert an LVAD and then she was put on the transplant list. ''("[[Go It Alone]]")''

Frankie's LVAD failed to reverse the heart damage, which left her in desperate need of a heart. One became available, but when they transplanted it, they discovered that it had been damaged during retrieval and couldn't keep her alive. When a second heart became available, Arizona and Alex went to retrieve it personally while Frankie was kept on bypass in the hospital. While they were gone, Ivy declined rapidly, bumping up her status. Cristina made the decision to redirect the second heart to Ivy, who was more stable and had a better chance of survival, while she attempted a total artificial heart on Frankie. That procedure was unsuccessful and Frankie was pronounced dead in the OR. ''("[[Change of Heart]]")''

After Frankie's funeral, Sabine snapped at an orderly who tried to take Frankie's pillow. ''("[[We Are Never Ever Getting Back Together]]")''


While waiting in Frankie\us room while the doctors talked to his parents, Link started to cough up pink fluid just as Frankie had. ''("[[You Be Illin']]")''

Link was diagnosed with cardiomyopathy and declined quickly. They attempted to put him on a Berlin Heart, but he was clotting too much. They put him on ECMO and he stabilized. However, after  days on ECMO, he began clotting even with heparin. Owen was able to convince the FDA to give compassionate release to use a drug-eluting heart pump to buy Link more time to wait for a heart transplant. The device was implanted successfully and they said they'd wait  hours and start to wake him up. ''("[[I'm Winning]]")''

Link's heart pump worked well, keeping him stable as he waited for a heart transplant. ''("[[Change of Heart]]")''

Link was later discharged and allowed to wait for a heart transplant at home. ''("[[We Are Never Ever Getting Back Together]]")''

A heart became available for Link during the aftermath of the explosion at the Mall of the Woods. Despite this, they had Link come in to [[Grey Sloan Memorial Hospital]] for his transplant. The transplant was successful. ''("[[Fear (of the Unknown)]]")''


A few weeks after Link's heart transplant, [[Maggie Pierce]], who was looking into genetic causes of cardiomyopathy for another patient, discovered what had caused the McNeil kids' cardiomyopathy. A mutation called RAF  had been discovered to cause cardiomyopathy only a week before and all three McNeil children had that mutation. Sabine was relieved that it wasn't something in their house or something she had done. ''("[[Puzzle With a Piece Missing]]")''



Ivy has two siblings, both of whom, like herself, have been diagnosed with cardiomyopathy.


*She wants to be on student council at her school.<ref>[[You Be Illin']], x</ref>

'''Jamal Clark''' is the son of [[Simon Clark|Simon]] and [[Kristen Clark]].


Jamal's parents tried for three years to conceive after his father was diagnosed with cancer. When his cancer returned while Kristen was pregnant, Simon was desperate to live long enough to meet his son before he died. ''("[[I'll Cover You]]")'' Simon started chemotherapy treatments with the hope that it would give him enough time to get Kristen to a safe point to have a c-section. During this time, she had some contractions, but they were determined to be Braxton-Hicks. ''("[[Stronger Than Hate]]

When Kristen got to  weeks, they started to worry that Simon wouldn't make it and put him on ECMO to buy him just a little more time. ''("[[Out for Blood]]")'' Soon afterward, Kristen experienced a placental abruption, forcing an immediate c-section delivery. As soon as he was cleared, Jamal was taken down to see his father, who kissed him and told him hello forever before dying. ''("[[You Are the Blood]]")''



His father always wanted to be a dad.


*Though his dad has an uncle named Jamal, he was named after his mother.

'''Jean Dominy''' came into the ER with a hip injury shortly after having heart surgery.



Jean was married to the same man for  years. In that time, they had a whole lifetime's worth of memories, including having  children and  grandchildren.


Fifteen years prior to her second hip surgery, she had had a hip replacement.


Jean had heart surgery to have a stent placed. She was also put on blood thinners to prevent clots.


A week after being discharged, Jean came back to the hospital after the earthquake. She had fallen on her hip while having sex during the earthquake, so she came into the ER. In the ER, Maggie cleared her heart and Callie examined her hip. There was severe bruising, so Callie ordered x-rays, which revealed a below the stem femur fracture. Callie's initial plan meant replacing the hardware and extending the stem to cover the break. However, Maggie said it wasn't the best idea given her recent heart troubles. Callie agreed to look at the scans again. When she did, she said that Jean definitely needed surgery, but instead of replacing the hip again, she could place a plate, a shorter surgery. The surgery was successful and when she woke up, Jean was told she'd need to wait eight weeks to put her new hip to work.



Husband
She was married for  years until her husband died. She stated he's the only man she's ever loved and the only man she'll ever love.

Other Men
After her husband died, Jean decided that she still have a lot of time left and a lot of things she wanted to do, so she sought out sexual partners. One of them is Herbert, who lives down the hall from her, with whom she was having sex when she fell. Edward and Irving, as well as an unnamed man with a bad toupee, were also listed among her lovers.


She and her husband had three children and seven grandchildren.


*She was  at the time of her hip injury.
*She had a book with all the sexual positions. She was doing number  with Herbert when the earthquake hit.

'''Jeannie Reed''' is the daughter of [[Marjorie Reed]].


Jeannie's mother, Marjorie, had small-cell lung cancer with mets on her liver. Her condition was terminal. She coded one morning, but was able to be revived. However, she was in extreme pain. When Jeannie stepped out of the room, Marjorie talked to [[Maggie Pierce|Dr. Pierce]] and asked to be allowed to die. When she was offered the chance to sign DNR papers, she said Jeannie would never allow it and her daughter had her power of attorney.

When she coded again later that day while Jeannie was out getting dinner, Maggie did a slow code and allowed her to die.



Her father was dead. Her mother had terminal lung cancer. Unbeknownst to her, her mother wanted to die despite Jeannie's desire to keep her alive. While Jeannie was out getting dinner, her mother coded and died. When she heard of her mother's death, she was devastated.

'''Jeremy Weaver''' was a patient who came in with heartburn, but was ultimately diagnosed with cancer.


Jeremy came into the ER with what he believed to be heartburn. Dr. Pierce examined him and ruled out a heart attack and aortic dissection, so she handed his case off to Dr. Bailey, who began to run tests to find out the cause. Jeremy was in a rush to get out of the hospital as quickly as possible so he could get back to work, so he agreed to skip a less invasive test and go straight to esophagogastroduodenoscopy. However, the EGD revealed a large tumor, which the doctors determined to be adenocarcinoma. His diet caused severe acid reflux, which made his esophagus the perfect breeding ground for cancer. They planned an esophagectomy, which involved removing part of his esophagus along with the tumor and replacing it with part of his colon. However, shortly after they started his surgery, he coded and was unable to be resuscitated.



Jeremy is married to [[Ellen Weaver]]. Together, they have a daughter, [[Erin Weaver]].


Jeremy has a daughter, Erin. While he was in the hospital waiting for tests, he asked the doctors to get him out of there quickly as he needed to go pick her up. When he found out that he had cancer, he asked his wife to tell Erin, but not in a way that would scare her.


It is unknown exactly what Jeremy does, but he was concerned about missing meetings with his clients, as he says he has a lot of balls in the air.


*He was  at the time of his death.

'''Jon McNeil''' is the father of [[Ivy McNeil|Ivy]], [[Francesca McNeil|Frankie]], and [[Lincoln McNeil|Link McNeil]], all of whom developed cardiomyopathy.



Ivy, , was diagnosed with dilated cardiomyopathy. She spent four months waiting for a heart transplant before one came through. The transplant was successful and Ivy began to recover. ''("[[You Be Illin']]")''

Two weeks post-op, Ivy's indices were good and she was recovering well. ''("[[I'm Winning]]")''

Later, Ivy spiked a fever. Cristina took her to the OR for a biopsy, which revealed that she was rejecting her donor heart. They treated it with anti-rejection medication and put Ivy back on the transplant list. ''("[[Go It Alone]]")''

Still in full rejection, Ivy was kept in isolation. While Frankie was in surgery to receive a heart transplant, Ivy declined, bumping up her status to A. When a second heart was found to replace the one that failed for Frankie, it was instead redirected to Ivy. The transplant was successful and she was recovering well. ''("[[Change of Heart]]")''

Ivy was later discharged to recover at home. ''("[[We Are Never Ever Getting Back Together]]")''


While Ivy was in surgery getting her new heart, Jon brought their second child, Frankie, into the ER because she was coughing up pink fluid. She, too, was diagnosed with cardiomyopathy. The doctors inserted a pacemaker. ''("[[You Be Illin']]")''

Two weeks after her pacemaker was inserted, Frankie was doing well, even walking around the hospital. ''("[[I'm Winning]]")''

While playing Hide and Seek with [[Braden Morris]], Frankie collapsed in a hallway. When she was found, her pulse was weak and she wasn't breathing well. She was taken into surgery to insert an LVAD and then she was put on the transplant list. ''("[[Go It Alone]]")''

Frankie's LVAD failed to reverse the heart damage, which left her in desperate need of a heart. One became available, but when they transplanted it, they discovered that it had been damaged during retrieval and couldn't keep her alive. When a second heart became available, Arizona and Alex went to retrieve it personally while Frankie was kept on bypass in the hospital. While they were gone, Ivy declined rapidly, bumping up her status. Cristina made the decision to redirect the second heart to Ivy, who was more stable and had a better chance of survival, while she attempted a total artificial heart on Frankie. That procedure was unsuccessful and Frankie was pronounced dead in the OR. ''("[[Change of Heart]]")''

After Frankie's funeral, Sabine snapped at an orderly who tried to take Frankie's pillow. ''("[[We Are Never Ever Getting Back Together]]")''


While waiting in Frankie\us room while the doctors talked to his parents, Link started to cough up pink fluid just as Frankie had. ''("[[You Be Illin']]")''

Link was diagnosed with cardiomyopathy and declined quickly. They attempted to put him on a Berlin Heart, but he was clotting too much. They put him on ECMO and he stabilized. However, after  days on ECMO, he began clotting even with heparin. Owen was able to convince the FDA to give compassionate release to use a drug-eluting heart pump to buy Link more time to wait for a heart transplant. The device was implanted successfully and they said they'd wait  hours and start to wake him up. ''("[[I'm Winning]]")''

Link's heart pump worked well, keeping him stable as he waited for a heart transplant. ''("[[Change of Heart]]")''

Link was later discharged and allowed to wait for a heart transplant at home. ''("[[We Are Never Ever Getting Back Together]]")''

A heart became available for Link during the aftermath of the explosion at the Mall of the Woods. Despite this, they had Link come in to [[Grey Sloan Memorial Hospital]] for his transplant. The transplant was successful. ''("[[Fear (of the Unknown)]]")''


A few weeks after Link's heart transplant, [[Maggie Pierce]], who was looking into genetic causes of cardiomyopathy for another patient, discovered what had caused the McNeil kids' cardiomyopathy. A mutation called RAF  had been discovered to cause cardiomyopathy only a week before and all three McNeil children had that mutation. Sabine was relieved that it wasn't something in their house or something she had done. ''("[[Puzzle With a Piece Missing]]")''



[[Sabine McNeil]]
Jon is married to Sabine McNeil, with whom he has three kids. When the stress of their three kids being in the hospital started to get to them, they fought, Jon walked out, and Sabine wondered if it would destroy their marriage. However, Jon came back, saying that he had fallen asleep in the car and his phone had died. He apologized and they made up.


Jon has three children, all of whom had been diagnosed with cardiomyopathy. His middle child, Frankie, ultimately died of her condition, while Ivy and Link received heart transplants.


[[Cristina Yang]]
Both Sabine and Jon grew to know and trust Cristina Yang while their children were hospitalized. When Cristina disappeared after losing the [[Catherine Fox Award|Harper Avery Award]], they were discontent with having [[Jeff Russell]] do Frankie's heart transplant.

'''Judi Roberts''' is the mother of [[Maya Roberts]].


Judi came into the hospital with her daughter, Maya, who had chondrosarcoma. She had her leg amputated two years prior because of it. When it recurred in her chest, Maya went looking for a miracle and ended up at [[Grey Sloan Memorial Hospital]]. [[Alex Karev]] initially suggested using titanium plates to bridge the gap left by removing the cancer, recommended by [[Callie Torres]] and [[Maggie Pierce]]. Maya rejected that suggestion because of the need for revision surgeries and the fragility of the titanium plates.

Maya asked Callie and Maggie for other options and when they suggested D printed ribs to replace the defect left by removing her cancer, she decided she wanted to go with that. Judi was a little hesitant, but signed the papers when Maya insisted it's what she wanted, over the advice of Alex, who wanted to go with a more conservative approach.

Maya had her surgery and was stable and awake afterward.



She raised her daughter, Maya, by herself after having her very young. She let Maya take the lead in her own medical care because she doesn't really understand it and Maya has a head for that kind of thing.


She works two jobs to pay the bills and keep Maya on the good insurance.

{{DEFAULTSORT:Roberts, Judi}}

'''Julian''' is the best friend of [[Lucille Reid]].


Julian went to the hospital with Lucille, his best friend, who was at the hospital for a syncopal work-up after falling at home. The work-up showed nothing, but when Julian mentioned that she'd been dizzy, Teddy ordered a CT Angio and a neuro consult. The test results showed stenosis and an aneurysm, so she had surgery for both problems at once. She was stable and awake after her surgery.



He was married to a woman named Shirl for ten years. Shirl never believed that he and Lucille were just friends.


He and Lucille have been best friends for forty years. Because they valued their friendship so much, they never pursued romance, despite having strong feelings for each other.

'''Julian Fisher''' was in a car accident on the way from his father's funeral.


Julian and his family were leaving his father's funeral when a car hit them, causing a chain reaction that led to the hearse being hit and causing his father's body to be thrown out of his casket. They were all taken to the hospital, where Julian had a cut on his forehead and a broken arm. He was near his panicked sister, Morgan. He angrily declared that they were making a list of all their injuries and they weren't paying for any of it.

While they were waiting at the hospital, they learned that their estranged sister, Kara, was at the hospital as well and was the driver who hit them. The two siblings firmly blamed her for their problems. Their mother, Georgia, went and sat with her father's body, which had been brought to the hospital along with the injured. She then had a heart attack. The doctors tried to resuscitate, but she was pronounced dead. In their grief, the family decided to have a makeshift funeral, each taking time to sit and talk to Georgia. While Morgan was in the room, she suddenly called out that Georgia had squeezed her hand. The doctors dismissed it as a residual reflex, but then Georgia suddenly sat up in the bed. After some tests, the proclaimed Georgia healthy despite having been pronounced dead. Morgan and Julian then decided to go visit Kara and her newborn son and start to mend fences.



He seems to get along well with his sister, Morgan, and his mother. However, he was estranged from his sister, Kara, for many years prior to their father's funeral. After their mother died and then unexpectedly came back, Morgan and Julian reached out to try to mend fences.

'''Kara Fisher''' was in a car accident on the way to her father's funeral.


Kara was estranged from her family for many years. When she got a call that her father had died, she decided to go to his funeral. However, she was late, so she was rushing and caused a car accident which led to several members of her family being taken to the hospital, including herself. She was  weeks pregnant and had a broken pelvis. A CT showed that while there was bleeding, it wasn't serious enough to have surgery, so they watched her and waited.

She learned while hospitalized that her family was there and was encouraged to try reconnecting with them. However, before she could do this, her brother rushed in an accused her of killing their mother, who had died of a heart attack. Kara started to panic and the baby became unstable, so she was rushed for a c-section.

After her surgery, Kara was visited by her brother and sister, who told her their mom was alive after all and they wanted to start to mend fences.



She was estranged from her parents and siblings for many years. After learning that her father had died, she tried to go to his funeral, but ended up causing an accident that led to the hospitalization of many members of the family. While in the hospital, she gave birth to her son and started to mend fences with her family.


*She has a history of drug use.
